title: The Directed Prediction Index
text: DPIX→Y=t2⋅ΔR2=tβXY|Covs2⋅(RY∼X+Covs2−RX∼Y+Covs2)=tpartial.rXY|Covs2⋅(RY∼X+Covs2−RX∼Y+Covs2) \begin{aligned} \text{DPI}_{X \rightarrow Y} & = t^2 \cdot \Delta R^2 \\ & = t_{\beta_{XY|Covs}}^2 \cdot (R_{Y \sim X + Covs}^2 - R_{X \sim Y + Covs}^2) \\ & = t_{partial.r_{XY|Covs}}^2 \cdot (R_{Y \sim X + Covs}^2 - R_{X \sim Y + Covs}^2) \end{aligned} econometrics broader social sciences, exogenous variable assumed unidirectional (causal quasi-causal) influence endogenous variable (ExoVar→EndoVarExoVar \rightarrow EndoVar). quantifying relative endogeneity outcome versus predictor variables multiple linear regression models, DPI can suggest plausible direction influence (e.g., DPIX→Y>0: X→Y\text{DPI}_{X \rightarrow Y} > 0 \text{: } X \rightarrow Y) controlling sufficient number potential confounding variables. uses ΔRYvs.X2\Delta R_{Y vs. X}^2 test whether YY (outcome), compared XX (predictor), can strongly predicted mm observable control variables (included regression model) kk unobservable random covariates (specified k.cov; see DPI). higher R2R^2 indicates relatively higher dependence (.e., relatively higher endogeneity) given variable set. also uses tpartial.r2t_{partial.r}^2 penalize insignificant partial correlation (rpartialr_{partial}, equivalent tt test βpartial\beta_{partial}) YY XX, ignoring sign (±\pm) correlation. higher t2t^2 (equivalent FF test value df=1df = 1) indicates robust (less spurious) partial relationship controlling variables. Simulation samples k.cov random covariates generated test statistical significance DPI.

title: The Directed Prediction Index (DPI). — DPI
text: Directed Prediction Index (DPI) simulation-based conservative method quantifying relative endogeneity (relative dependence) outcome (Y) vs. predictor (X) variables multiple linear regression models. comparing proportion variance explained (R-squared) Y--outcome model X--outcome model controlling sufficient number potential confounding variables, suggests plausible influence direction exogenous variable (X) endogenous variable (Y). Methodological details provided https://psychbruce.github.io/DPI/.

title: The Directed Prediction Index (DPI). — DPI
text: model Model object (lm). y Dependent (outcome) variable. x Independent (predictor) variable. data [Optional] Defaults NULL. data specified, model ignored linear model lm({y} ~ {x} + .) fitted inside. helpful exploring variables dataset. k.cov Number random covariates (simulating potential omitted variables) added simulation sample. Defaults 1. Please also test different k.cov values robustness checks (see DPI_curve). k.cov > 0, raw data (without bootstrapping) used, k.cov random variables appended, simulation. k.cov = 0 (suggested), bootstrap samples (resampling replacement) used simulation. n.sim Number simulation samples. Defaults 1000. seed Random seed replicable results. Defaults NULL. progress Show progress bar. Defaults FALSE (n.sim < 5000). file File name saved plot (".png" ".pdf"). width, height Width height (inches) saved plot. Defaults 6 4. dpi Dots per inch (figure resolution). Defaults 500.

title: Correlation network plot. — cor_network
text: data Data. index Type graph: "cor" (raw correlation network) "pcor" (partial correlation network). Defaults "cor". show.value Show correlation coefficients significance edges. Defaults TRUE. show.insig Show edges insignificant correlations (p > 0.05). Defaults FALSE. change significance level, please set alpha parameter (defaults alpha=0.05). show.cutoff Show cut-values correlations. Defaults FALSE. faded Transparency edges according effect size correlation. Defaults FALSE. text.size Scalar font size variable labels. Defaults 1.2. node.group list indicates nodes belong together, element list vector integers identifying column numbers variables belong together. node.color vector color element node.group, color node. edge.color.pos Color (significant) positive correlations. Defaults "#0571B0" (blue ColorBrewer's RdBu palette). edge.color.neg Color (significant) negative correlations. Defaults "#CA0020" (red ColorBrewer's RdBu palette). edge.color.insig Color insignificant correlations. Defaults "#EEEEEEEE" (transparent grey). title Plot title. file File name saved plot (".png" ".pdf"). width, height Width height (inches) saved plot. Defaults 6 4. dpi Dots per inch (figure resolution). Defaults 500. ... parameters passed qgraph.
